answers.answer: Awe its poopy. But think positive as long as your baby is healthy that's what matters. I've had had both vaginal and c section. I can honestly say neither.one was worse for.pain and stuff. So try to relax it will help. Good luck momma.
Aww...so sorry...just look at it this way, no more preeclampsia and you get to hold your baby girl tomorrow....it's going to be ok... good luck!

I'm sorry.. I totally understand...idk what we're gonna do with our little misses!! Jus pray for the best... You'll be OK and u and baby will be together soon...both healthy!! Good luck and congratulations... Keep us posted once miss thang arrives❤
They will check you before csection tomorrow again to make sure.  Pray and google some baby turning exercise.  Goodluck!  Itll be all worth it seeing her face!
If they are going to schedule a c section why don't to u ask them to at least try doing a version (where the doctor tries to carefully turn the baby through outside your belly)

Thanks for the aupport ladies. I'm ok, I just don't want the long recovery time with the c section. I also havw an 8 year old and taking care of them both is no bueno when in a lot od pain. They won't try to flip her because I'm already high risk so c section it is. I guess now I don't have to worry about deciding if I want the epidural or not lol, that's pretty much made up. I'll update my birth story tomorrow!
Aww sorry you're going through all that, my sister just had that happen to her. Once you hold that precious girl in your arms it won't matter how she got here.
Sorry tk hear that best of luck to you..ive had two natural births and two c cections nither is worse thN the other...

Arh no :-( that's another issue with me my girl is oblique breech so they will also see at 36wks if shes moved or not. The consultant said he would be reluctant to turn her due to my issues with my bp. Its my final baby and I just feel shes going to test everything with me too lol hope it all goes well for you x x

I feel your pain.I am terrified of possible have a c-section (you never know)but think about it this way,it is out of your control -so why worry?Worrying will not help.I hope it all goes well.Just focus on the main thing, having your baby safe and sound.You'll figure the rest out.<3 stay strong.It will be fine. :)Soon you will have your baby!(I'm quite jealous, can't wait to have mine!)
Oh bugger, didnt know that could haplen with Such lil room to move

question: So I was scheduled for induction at midnight. The doc came in to do an ultrasound and my baby flipped and is now breech! I just had an ultrasound yesterday morning and she was head down. Now I'm scheduled for a c section at noon tomorrow and I hate it. I wasn't too happy about induction to begin with but I really don't want a c section! First preeclampsia and now this, this little girl has been nothing but trouble lol. Didn't have all thus fuss when I was pregnant with my son. But seriously, this ***** :(
title: Crying :(
